text: May 12 British catering company Compass Group Plc said on Wednesday its margins in the third quarter would improve sequentially, supported by the companys cost cutting measures after reporting a pandemic-slump in first-half profit.The company, which serves office workers, school kids, seniors in old age homes and armed forces across 45 countries, said underlying operating profit fell 64.5% to 290 million pounds ($409.74 million) in the six months to March 31.
